availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Prentis (Virginia-born, Kentucky merchant and farmer in Hancock County)

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, merchant and farmer. Virginia native. Married to Lucy W. Baugh Prentis. Father of W. T. Prentis, Robert C. Prentis, A. B. Prentis, Ann Prentis, Margaret J. Prentis, Earnest Prentis, Lucy T. Prentis, Hallack Prentis, and Beauscan Prentis. Educated at William & Mary College. Purchased land on which Lewisport, Kentucky was founded. Magistrate in Hancock County. One of the founders of the Lewisport Pond Draining Company in 1858. Farmer in Hancock County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Hancock County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 68.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 6.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Lewisport Voting District, p. 22.
W. H. Perrin, J. H. Battle, and G. C. Kniffin, Kentucky: A History of the State (Louisville: F. A. Battey and Company, 1887), 755.
"Prentis Papers," MSS 32 Finding Aid, Western Kentucky University (http://digitalcommons.wku.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=2867&context=dlscmssfinaid) (accessed on March 29, 2017).
"An Act to Incorporate the Lewisport Pond Draining Company," _Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Frankfort, Ky.: A. G. Hodges, Public Printer, 1858), 234-238.
